title: Textile, 17th century
medium:
Medium: silk, metal
Technique: plain weave with continuous supplementary weft patterning
dimensions: Warp x Weft (selvedge to selvedge): 57.3 x 59.3 cm (22 9/16 x 23 3/8 in.)
description: Red ribbed silk ground with a large-scale symmetrical palmette surrounded by four serrated leaves connected by a crown. The pattern is formed by one horizontal rib having an extra white silk weft and the alternating rib having a narrow strip of flat silver.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 17th century.Medium: silk, metal
Technique: plain weave with continuous supplementary weft patterning. Gift of Raimundo de Madrazo. 1898-1-9.
